# setObject(_:at:)

**Instance Method**

Appends or replaces the object at the specified index.

## Declaration

```swift
func setObject(_ obj: Any, at idx: Int)
```

## Parameters

- **obj**: The object to insert or append.
- **idx**: The index. If the index is equal to the length of the collection, then it inserts the object at that index, otherwise it replaces the object at that index with the given object.

## Adding, Removing, and Reordering Entries

- **add(_:)**: Appends a given object to the end of the mutable ordered set, if it is not already a member.
- **add(_:count:)**: Appends the given number of objects from a given C array to the end of the mutable ordered set.
- **addObjects(from:)**: Appends to the end of the mutable ordered set each object contained in a given array that is not already a member.
- **insert(_:at:)**: Inserts the given object at the specified index of the mutable ordered set, if it is not already a member.
- **insert(_:at:)**: Inserts the objects in the array at the specified indexes.
- **remove(_:)**: Removes a given object from the mutable ordered set.
- **removeObject(at:)**: Removes a the object at the specified index from the mutable ordered set.
- **removeObjects(at:)**: Removes the objects at the specified indexes from the mutable ordered set.
- **removeObjects(in:)**: Removes the objects in the array from the mutable ordered set.
- **removeObjects(in:)**: Removes from the mutable ordered set each of the objects within a given range.
- **removeAllObjects()**: Removes all the objects from the mutable ordered set.
- **replaceObject(at:with:)**: Replaces the object at the specified index with the new object.
- **replaceObjects(at:with:)**: Replaces the objects at the specified indexes with the new objects.
- **replaceObjects(in:with:count:)**: Replaces the objects in the receiving mutable ordered set at the range with the specified number of objects from a given C array.
- **moveObjects(at:to:)**: Moves the objects at the specified indexes to the new location.
